#Text=Ryanair threaten legal action after documentary on fuel policy , safety
#Text=Wednesday , August 14 , 2013
#Text=Irish budget airline Ryanair have stated intent to sue the UK 's Channel 4 over a documentary broadcast Monday night which discussed safety at the airline .
#Text=Secrets of the Cockpit focused strongly on fuel policy and featured interviews with pilots .
#Text=A Ryanair Boeing 737 pictured in 2006 .
#Text=Image : WikiABG .
#Text=Part of the Dispatches series , the show reported on an incident in Spain last year where three Ryanair jets declared fuel emergencies after being diverted to Valencia .
#Text=Pilots interviewed for the programme said they felt pressured to save fuel , the cost of which has hit Ryanair 's profits .
#Text=The Spanish Air Authority described Ryanair flights usually landing with a bare minimum of fuel , in a report the airline dismissed as " manifestly inaccurate and factually untrue " .
#Text=Ryanair say their planes carry more fuel than European Union legislation requires and point out the Irish Aviation Authority ( IAA ) monitor their safety record , including fuel policy .
#Text=Ryanair has never had a fatal accident and the IAA called Secrets of the Cockpit a " misguided attack " which was " based upon false and misleading information " .

#Text=The IAA itself was accused of failing to respond to concerns from Ryanair pilots and one interviewee said his " personal belief is that the majority of Ryanair pilots do not have confidence in the safety agencies and that is a pretty critical issue " .

#Text=An IAA statement yesterday morning read " The IAA has responded to personal letters and reports from Ryanair pilots , this included several meetings and face-to-face interviews with pilots and their legal and professional representatives . "
#Text=The statement added " Ryanair Plc fully complies with all European and international regulations in all areas of its operations " .
#Text=We stand by our journalism , and will robustly defend proceedings if they are initiated — Channel 4
#Text=Channel 4 promised to see Ryanair in court , saying " We stand by our journalism , and will robustly defend proceedings if they are initiated . "
#Text=Ryanair called the documentary " false and defamatory " .

#Text=Other claims in the documentary included that twelve cockpit voice recorders had been wiped after serious incidents , which Ryanair blamed on pilot error and said is a common occcurence in aviation , and that a survey by Ryanair Pilots Group ( RPG ) found widespread safety concerns at the airline .
#Text=RPG is not recognised by the airline which calls the group " [ lacking ] any independence , objectivity or reliability " .
#Text=The airline says they conducted their survey , which polled 1,000 flight crew , as part of a long campaign to unionise Ryanair pilots .

#Text=The airline makes heavy use of zero-hour contracts , which do not guarantee work and which the Irish Airline Pilots ’ Association describe as offering some of aviation 's worst employment conditions .
#Text=According to the RPG survey almost 90 % of respondents said the safety culture was nontransparent .
#Text=Two-thirds said they felt uncomfortable raising safety issues .
#Text=Ryanair had told pilots anybody signing a " so-called safety petition " might be dismissed .

column1: #Text=One anonymous pilot interviewed by Channel 4 accused the airline of " threats and bullying " .
#Text=Over 90 % of those surveyed wanted a regulatory inquiry , with RPG saying the survey results were passed to the airline and the IAA .

#Text=RPG chairman Evert van Zwol , also a recent Dutch Airline Pilots Association president , said zero-hour contracts tended to make pilots choose to fly when unwell and keep quiet if they had safety concerns .
#Text=In 2005 a Polish Ryanair pilot became lost near Rome a few days after attending his son 's funeral , while his Dutch co-pilot was seeing his first experience of navigating severe weather .
#Text=In the 2005 incident air traffic control intervened to keep the flight safe from midair collisions .
#Text=The Polish pilot told Italian investigators he feared losing his job if he took extra time off work .
#Text=The investigation concluded in 2009 he had been unfit to fly .
#Text=Ryanair denied he would have been fired for taking time off to recover .
